response.answer_text: Will Native Apps Actually Die? Even if they will eventually die out, it promises to be a slow death. The existing web pages won’t go anywhere and a lot of traditional websites will still be created. However, the more tech and business-savvy people and especially companies will adopt at least one of the two practices we described earlier at an even faster rate. As a result, this is a trend you will definitely see more often.  The democratization of technology is already happening. These practices will become more and more accessible in the future. Soon there simply won’t be a legitimate enough reason to create an outdated and inferior web app. One thing left to consider is the mobile marketplace. There is money to be made there. As a result, established brands like Twitter, for example, will use both native and PWA versions of their service. Also, companies with complex apps that can’t be easily converted into a web page will still be a fixture of any app store. In fact, they will dominate the field of mobile software since more providers will switch to PWA or React Native for Web instead. It won’t be a momentary change. Old habits die hard after all. Instead, it will be a steady trend that people will discover more and more as this technology advances. More in article
